job_title: Anonymous Employee in Bellevue, OH
pros: Many Benefits, such as 401K matching, good insurance options, payroll deduction for meals and gift shop, and they do many events for the employees, such as cookouts, book sales, uniform sales, garden markets, and giveaways. Other staff are very helpful to new hires. Focused on patient and employee safety. Not as busy and crazy as big hospitals. There are many positives to working here, and 99% of the other employees are friendly and helpful.
cons:
Many practices for record keeping are outdated. Some supervisors/department leads are completely against change when it comes to updating practices.
Slightly lower pay than what larger hospitals would offer, but not unexpected from such a small community hospital.

job_title: Social Worker in New York, NY
pros: Opportunity to work with diverse patients with varying conditions. Freedom to use any psychotherapeutic style that interests you.
cons: Total lack of quality supervision, supervisor was abusive and judgmental of countertransference, calling me “too emotional,” to be a therapist. At one point became clear supervisor may have been having nervous breakdown due to personality splitting. She was unempathic but not unemotional. She was just full of rage.

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in New York, NY
pros: STRONG union- base support. Most employees are the best I have ever worked with. Great place to practice skills and patients have very high acuity. Therefore, it is a great foundation to "handle anything"
cons: Poor staff retention. Contributes to lack of safety of employees. Patients are generally psyche patients even on non-psyche floors and can be VERY unstable. As stated in the cons,, you literally "handle anything" and there seems to be a lack of empathy from management to floor nurses in egards to the VERY unsafe work setting.

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in New York, NY
pros: It caters to all kinds of patients, documented or not; with or without insurance
cons:
Management very complacent in disciplining employees. Does not adhere to policies/protocols. Reluctant to implement fair judgment in abusive situations. Politicism and favoritism are overwhelming: promotes people, who are undeserving; protects wrongdoers thru manipulations/cover-ups; unfair practices are habitually observed; corruption and other uncalled for  situations prevail. 
Caters to all patients without insurance at the expense of tax payers, yet, patients abuse staff too often.
